description: The crash occurred on a level two lane undivided roadway with a posted speed limit of 55 MPH (89 KPH).  The weather was clear, the roadway dry and it was daylight at the time of the crash.     Vehicle 1, a 1996 Honda Civic, was traveling east on the roadway behind Vehicle 2, a 2002 GMC Envoy.  Vehicle 2 observes a non-contact vehicle in front of it slowing to make a left into a driveway.  Vehicle 2 decelerates and is struck in the rear by the front of Vehicle 1.  Vehicle 2 is pushed forward and drives off the road to the right coming to rest facing east off the south shoulder.  V1 came to rest facing east off the south shoulder.Vehicle 1 was towed due to damage and Vehicle 2 was driven from the scene.  Police did not consider either alcohol or illegal drugs to be involved and ordered no tests.

The crash occurred in the intersection of a signalized one-way roadway and a two-way roadway.  The roadway was straight and level, and it was clear with no adverse conditions.  It was daylight and the roadway was dry and had a downhill grade of -2/61.Vehicle # 1 was a 1999 International M/H Truck that was traveling westbound on the middle lane of the roadway.  Vehicle # 2 was a 2002 Saturn SL that was traveling westbound on the right lane.  Vehicle # 1 was making a right turn at the intersection when he was impacted on the right side by the front of Vehicle # 1.The International truck (Vehicle # 1) was driven by a 29 year-old male who did not sustain any injuries.  The passenger in the front right seating position also did not sustain any injuries.  The International truck was not towed due to damage.

The crash occurred in the northbound lane of a two-lane, T-intersection roadway.  Conditions were daylight and dry at 8:58 am on a Monday afternoon.  The roadway had a posted speed of 40 MPH and was level.  There was a road department truck in the center of the double-yellow line approximately 100-150 feet north from point of impact.     V1 was a 1994 Dodge 350 Ram Van going straight in the northbound lane.  V2 was a 1992 Toyota Camry sedan traveling south in the southbound lane.  V2 made a left turn in front of V1 and the front of V2 struck the left side of V1 in the northbound lane.  The impact rotated V2 180 degrees and came to final rest in the northbound lane.  V1 came to final rest against the apex of the northeast curb.

The crash occurred in the westbound lane of a four-lane roadway with a median and a traffic control signal.  Conditions were daylight and dry in the morning on a weekday.  The posted speed limit was 80 KMPH (50 MPH).     V1 was a 1997 Toyota Corolla sedan traveling westbound in the 1st travel lane approaching an intersection controlled by a traffic control signal intending on going straight.  V2, a 2003 Nissan Altima sedan, was decelerating in the 1st travel lane for the amber traffic control signal.  The front of V1 struck the back of V2 in the westbound lane.  Both vehicles came to final rest facing westbound.     A 26-year-old male who was not injured drove V1.  He stated that he was in the right lane when the traffic control turned amber and he thought he had enough time to make a complete stop.  The driver of V1 braked but was unable to avoid V2.  V1 was traveling between 50-64 KMPH (31-40 MPH) at the time of impact.  V1 was towed due to damage.

This crash occurred in the morning of a weekday in the eastbound lanes of an urban roadway near a T-intersection.  The east/west roadway consisted of two through lanes flanked by a designated right turn lane and a designated left turn lane in the eastbound direction and two through lanes in the westbound direction.  The bituminous roadway was dry, straight, and level, with a posted speed of 72 kmph (45 mph).  Traffic was congested, but flowing and there were no adverse atmospheric conditions at the time of the crash.	V1, a 1978 Chevrolet Corvette two-door with one occupant was eastbound in lane three.  V2, a 1990 Buick Regal two-door with one occupant was stopped eastbound in lane three ahead of V1 waiting for the light at the intersection ahead of him to turn green and traffic to proceed.  As light turned green and V2 began to accelerate V1 struck V2's rear.  A witness stated that the driver of V1 was traveling between 82-97 kmph (51-60 mph) when he made the avoidance action of steering right but could not avoid V2.  Both vehicles rolled forward and came to final rest near the point of impact.  Both vehicles were towed due to damage.  	The driver of V1, an unknown aged male, fled the scene shortly after maneuvering the vehicle off the road.  No further information could be obtained regarding the driver as the owner of the vehicle told the police it had been taken without him knowing.
